Chapter 2, the magic of imitation. Shadowing to sound like a native. Now that you know the power of talking every day, let me
share another simple but powerful way to practice English talking.
This way is called shadowing.
Yes, shadowing. You may ask what is shadowing? It is very easy.
Shadowing means you listen to someone speaking English, a native speaker, and you repeat after them at the same time
or just a second later. It is like you are their shadow. When they speak, you speak. When they stop, you stop. And when you do this, you are not just
saying words.
You are copying how they say the words.
You copy their voice, their rhythm, and even their feeling.
This is the magic of imitation.
Let me tell you how I found out about shadowing.
When I was learning English, I used to watch cartoons.
I did not know it was called shadowing at that time.
But I like to repeat the words I heard in the cartoon. I listened carefully.
When a character said, "Hello, how are you today?" I would say it too in the same way.
I tried to copy the sound, the speed, even the happy feeling in their voice.
And do you know what happened?
Slowly, I started to sound more natural.
My words became smoother. My English talking became better.
This is why I say shadowing is like magic. It helps you sound more like a native speaker and it helps you speak with more confidence.
Now you may think, "But how do I do this? What do I listen to?" The good news is you can choose anything simple.
If you are a beginner, I suggest starting with cartoons.
